Title: France names first Concorde jet a historical monument
Summary: France names first Concorde jet a historical monument . Concorde 001 was the first of the 20 aircraft built and the first to take to the skies in a test flight .

Title: ECOWAS court strengthening rule of law in West Africa – CJN
Summary: Chief Justice of Nigeria, Justice Kudirat Kekere-Ekun, said ECOWAS Court plays a critical role in safeguarding rights and strengthening the rule of law across West Africa . She said the court does not threaten national judiciaries but complements them .

Title: JAMB releases 2025 UTME results
Summary: JAMB releases results of the 2025 Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME) More than 1.5 million of the 1,955,069 applicants who took the 2025 UTME this year received scores lower than 200 .

Title: Fire razes four-bedroom flat in Ibadan
Summary: A Fire outbreak in the early hours of Monday razed a four-bedroom flat located at No. 1 Happiness Close, Akufo Estate, Elebu area of Ibadan . The General Manager of the Oyo State Fire Services Agency, disclosed this .

Title: Tinubu approves deployment of 2 new Perm Secs
Summary: Tinubu approves deployment of two new Perm Secs to key ministries . The move is aimed at enhancing governance, says Eno Olotu . He said the move was intended to enhance governance .

Title: FG’s silence on VDM’s arrest fuelled Abuja protests – PDP
Summary: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has criticized the Federal Government's silence surrounding the arrest of Martins Vincent Otse, popularly known as VeryDarkMan (VDM), which has led to widespread protests among youths .

Summary: Ruben Amorim has warned his Manchester United players that they have a "big responsibility" to win the Europa League . Title: From cyberbullying to defamation: Timeline of VeryDarkMan’s arrests
Summary: Martins Otse, widely known as VeryDarkMan, was arrested on May 2, 2025, in Abuja by the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission . The social media activist, who has gained a reputation for his confrontational style, has had multiple run-ins with the Nigerian authorities over the past two years .

Title: Poverty crisis: HURIWA backs Adesina, says presidency 'living in denial'
Summary: The Human Rights Writers Association has charged the Presidency not to live in denial over its criticism of comments made by the President of the African Development Bank, Dr Akinwunmi Adesina, regarding the country’s worsening poverty crisis . Title: EU unveils three healthcare, social protection projects in Sokoto
Summary: The Sokoto State Government on Monday, launched three major projects funded by the European Union, aimed at transforming healthcare delivery, social protection, and humanitarian support across the state . Title: Tinubu approves deployment of two new Perm Secs
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has approved the deployment of two newly appointed Federal Permanent Secretaries to key ministries . The move aimed at enhancing governance and promoting effective service delivery . The permanent secretaries were appointed following a competitive selection process and are expected to bring experience, professionalism and innovation to their respective roles .

Title: Defection: Resign, recontest, ex-PDP scribe dares Osun lawmaker
Summary: Oluwole Oke defected to the All Progressives Congress from the Peoples Democratic Party . The five-term lawmaker said the PDP would struggle to win future elections in the two local governments he represents .
